quantify every assertion from the IDs you have (tariffs rising to >10% of imports and the June trade deficit hitting record pace; exports ~1.01T vs imports ~1.70T and the export ratio stuck around the low-to-mid 20s% in 2025 versus a long-run near‑40%; autos tariffs moving from 27.5% toward 15% with some pass‑through to prices; average new-car loan ~6.43% and ongoing negative-equity risk; and Powell/Lagarde/Jackson Hole dynamics shaping the near‑term policy response) and avoid vague platitudes (0J41Q7KTX; S15934PBQ; CDBMWIUTB; U6HXAJR4J); reconcile conflicting signals on tariff pass‑through by stating both sides (e.g., Nikkei/Nikkei‑style reporting of pass‑through vs seasonal/explanatory claims) and show their implications for near‑term pricing and demand; include a concise monitoring checklist (August trade print, tariff policy moves, auto pricing trends, consumer credit delinquencies, and central‑bank communications) to guide next steps; drop tangential items (e.g., unrelated tourism data) and ensure every sentence ties back to the 0–3 week focus and the cited sources (0J41Q7KTX;
